lines: Operator: Commander Hale, we're reading you. The rover's telemetry is gone. Report.
Hale: The engine... it's dead. Fuel leak. I'm over 1000km from the ship.
Operator: Understood. Your food supplies won't last. You have no choice but to go on foot.
Operator: We've analyzed the terrain data. There are two potential routes. Listen carefully.
Operator: Stay calm, Hale. Every step counts.

choices.text: Proceed to the ridge, northeast of your position.
Walk towards the large crater to the northwest.
Check your remaining supplies before moving.

lines: Hale: Checking supplies… Oxygen at 70%, food packs: 2, water: 1 liter.
Operator: Good. You need to ration carefully. Keep moving, Hale.
Operator: You're heading for the ridge. It will be a hard climb, but it offers a high vantage point.
Hale: Copy that. Beginning my ascent... The rocks are loose here... I'm up. I can see something from here.
Hale: Down in the crater... it looks like a campsite.
Operator: Watch your footing, Hale. Any injury could be fatal at this distance.

choices.text: Too risky. Head for home instead.
Call back to Operator for further instructions.

lines: Hale: Operator, do you have any updates on the terrain?
Operator: Negative, Hale. The terrain data is incomplete. You must decide your path.
Hale: Understood. I'll take the ridge cautiously.
Operator: You're heading directly for the crater. Be cautious, we have no data on this area.
Hale: I'm approaching the crater rim... I see it. There's a makeshift campsite below. The fire's still hot, but... there's no one here. It's silent.
Operator: Stay alert. Something feels off about this place.
Hale: Copy that. Proceeding with caution.

choices.text: This is too strange. Head back to the ship.

lines: Hale: Moving around the crater's edge, scanning for any signs of life or danger.
Hale: There are footprints… recent. Someone was here not long ago.
Operator: Good observation. That might be valuable info. Proceed carefully.

choices.text: Return to the ridge for safety.

lines: Hale: I've reached the campsite. It's eerie. Tents are set up, but supplies are scattered everywhere. This place was abandoned in a hurry.
Operator: Any signs of life, Hale?
Hale: No, Operator. Just traces… like someone left in a hurry.

choices.text: Search the tents for anything useful.
Abort. Start walking back toward the ship.

lines: Hale: I'm searching the tents. Found some tools, a ration pack... it's half-eaten.
Hale: Wait... I heard something. A metallic clang, just outside.
Operator: Stay calm, Hale. You're not alone, be prepared for anything.
Hale: Copy that… I'm ready.
Hale: Operator, I hear something… outside the tents.
Operator: Stay calm, Hale. Keep low. Backup cannot reach you immediately.
Hale: Copy that. I'll proceed cautiously.
Hale: Hiding. I'm in one of the tents, behind some crates.
Hale: I hear voices... multiple. They don't sound... right. Guttural.
Hale: I'm peeking through a tear in the tent... I see someone. Another astronaut. But his suit is torn, and his skin... it's cracked, broken. He's not alone.
Hale: Moving to check the sound. Cautiously.
Hale: I'm rounding a large rock formation... There's someone here.
Hale: It's another astronaut. Suit's damaged, he looks gaunt... exhausted. He's raising his hand... I don't think it's a threat. I think he needs help.
Operator: Good assessment, Hale. Proceed carefully, help him if possible.

choices.text: Help the astronaut back to the ship.
Back away slowly… this is dangerous.

lines: Hale: Beginning long trek back to the ship.
Operator: Copy that, Commander. We're tracking you. Keep your pace steady.
Hours pass… The horizon glows with the warm light of your landing craft.
Operator: We see you! You're almost home!
Hale: Entering airlock… Life support stabilizing.
Operator: Welcome back, Commander. You survived Mars.
Hale: Something's wrong… the comms…
Operator: Commander? Your vitals just spiked—
A shadow moves across the camera feed. Distorted. Wrong.
Operator: Hale?! Respond!
…Static…
Operator: Signal lost. Commander Hale is gone.
